alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:41AM PDT until July 15 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas each year. In addition, the lowest low tides of the event will be observed during the early morning hours which may lead to trouble for mariners navigating shallow waterways. ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM PDT FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 2 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...North Bay Interior Valleys, San Francisco Bay Shoreline and San Francisco. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 3 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels will also rise along the Pacific coast but impacts will be more localized to areas along the SF Bay shoreline. Tide poolers and beachgoers should be familiar with the times and heights of local tidal levels to avoid hazards that may arise from rapidly shifting water levels..
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline
